repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Physical Plant Incinerator and Animal Science Building Records
did.abstract: WSU Physical Plant records regarding the WSU Animal Sciences Building from 1994-1998. Includes administrative files, grounds conditions, cost proposals, and reports.

bioghist.p: The WSU Physical Plant was originally known as Buildings and Grounds dating back to at least 1908 when a superintendent was appointed to the department. The department underwent a name change to Buildings and Grounds in the 1960's and a reorganizing in the 80's. The department is responsible for small scale construction and remodeling work around the WSU campus, as well as day to day maintenance.

scopecontent.p: Administrative files from Physical Plant about the Animal Science building, from 1994-1998. Includes costs of replacing items and item conditions within the Animal Science building, and costs on upgrading waste incinerator and the cost proposal for a new incinerator. Also includes early correspondence regarding draft sites for the WSU Pathological Waste and Solid Waste incinerator, as well as janitorial staff files.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Items are in their original order.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Physical Plant Incinerator and Animal Science Building Records, 1994-1998 (UA2000-15)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Rick Ward of Facilities on May 19, 2000 and retained as UA2000-15.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
